commit.message:
Makefile.in (check-po): New target for doing checks in the po subdir if all languages configured.

2000-10-24  Philipp Thomas  <pthomas@suse.de>

	* Makefile.in (check-po): New target for doing checks in the po
	subdir if all languages configured.
	(CHECK_TARGETS): Add @CHECK_PO@, replaced with check-po via
	configure if NLS is enabled.
	* configure.in: If NLS is enabled, substitute CHECK_PO by check-po,
	otherwise leave empty.
	* configure: Regenerate.

From-SVN: r37030

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,13 @@
+2000-10-24  Philipp Thomas  <pthomas@suse.de>
+
+	* Makefile.in (check-po): New target for doing checks in the po
+	subdir if all languages configured.
+	(CHECK_TARGETS): Add @CHECK_PO@, replaced with check-po via
+	configure if NLS is enabled.
+	* configure.in: If NLS is enabled, substitute CHECK_PO by check-po,
+	otherwise leave empty.
+	* configure: Regenerate.
+
 2000-10-23  Richard Henderson  <rth@cygnus.com>
 
 	* config/ia64/ia64.c (ia64_expand_prologue): Mark extra

@@ -2622,7 +2622,7 @@ site.exp: ./config.status Makefile
 		-e '1,/^## All variables above are.*##/ d' >> site.exp
 	-@rm -f ./tmp?
 
-CHECK_TARGETS = check-gcc check-g++ check-g77 check-objc
+CHECK_TARGETS = check-gcc check-g++ check-g77 check-objc @CHECK_PO@
 
 check: $(CHECK_TARGETS)
 
@@ -2675,6 +2675,12 @@ check-objc: testsuite/site.exp
 	    export TCL_LIBRARY ; fi ; \
 	$(RUNTEST) --tool objc $(RUNTESTFLAGS)
 
+check-po:
+	if test -f cp/Makefile && test -f f/Makefile && \
+	   test -f java/Makefile && test -f objc/Makefile; then \
+	   make -C po check-po; \
+	fi
+
 # These exist for maintenance purposes.
 
 # Update the tags table.

@@ -5439,7 +5439,7 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		;;
 	m68k-*-coff*)
 		tmake_file=m68k/t-m68kbare
-		tm_file="m68k/m68k-coff.h dbx.h libgloss.h"
+		tm_file="m68k/m68k-coff.h dbx.h"
 		extra_headers=math-68881.h
 		float_format=m68k
 		;;
@@ -7191,17 +7191,26 @@ if test "${build}" != "${host}" && test "x$enable_nls" = "xyes"; then
   enable_nls=no
 fi
 
+# if NLS is enabled, also enable check in po subdir
+if test $enable_nls = yes; then
+  CHECK_PO=check-po
+else
+  CHECK_PO=""
+fi
+
+
+
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7193: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:7206: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7201 "configure"
+#line 7214 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -7212,7 +7221,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7212: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7225: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -7235,12 +7244,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7235: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:7248: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7240 "configure"
+#line 7253 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -7289,7 +7298,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7289: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7302: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -7310,12 +7319,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7310: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:7323: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7315 "configure"
+#line 7328 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -7343,12 +7352,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7343: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:7356: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7348 "configure"
+#line 7361 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -7378,19 +7387,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7378: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:7391: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7383 "configure"
+#line 7396 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7390: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7403: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -7411,12 +7420,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7411: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:7424: checking for alloca" >&5

@@ -7444,7 +7453,7 @@ int main() {

@@ -7476,12 +7485,12 @@ EOF

 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)

@@ -7506,12 +7515,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7511 "configure"
+#line 7524 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */

 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7534: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7547: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then

@@ -7561,15 +7570,15 @@ done

 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7561: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:7574: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7569 "configure"
+#line 7582 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -7588,7 +7597,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7588: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:7601: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -7615,17 +7624,17 @@ unistd.h sys/param.h

 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7615: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:7628: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5

+if { (eval echo configure:7696: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then

     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6

 EOF

-echo "configure:7827: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
